title: Backend Independent Plots: Closing Issue #660

content.raw: I think this should be an instance attribute rather than a class method - that way different plots can have different interactive settings and yt doesn't gain more global state.
content.html: I think this should be an instance attribute rather than a class method - that way different plots can have different interactive settings and yt doesn't gain more global state.

content.raw: It would be nice to have similar helpers defined on the `PlotContainer` class that just iterates over the plots in the `plots` dictionary and calls these methods.
content.html: It would be nice to have similar helpers defined on the PlotContainer class that just iterates over the plots in the plots dictionary and calls these methods.

content.raw: I think this will cause the plot to not display in non-interactive mode in the notebook.
content.html: I think this will cause the plot to not display in non-interactive mode in the notebook.

content.raw: Can you give this pull request a more useful title? Also note in the title that it closes Issue #660!
content.html: Can you give this pull request a more useful title? Also note in the title that it closes Issue #660!

content.raw:
(which would be a backward-compatibility break)

I think you still need to do `display(self)` in non-interactive mode.
content.html:
(which would be a backward-compatibility break)

I think you still need to do display(self) in non-interactive mode.

content.raw:
Before this gets merged in it needs to be discussed in the documentation. This page is a likely place to put it: http://yt-project.org/docs/dev/visualizing/plots.html

Let me know if you need help with sphinx or editing the documentation.
content.html:
Before this gets merged in it needs to be discussed in the documentation. This page is a likely place to put it: http://yt-project.org/docs/dev/visualizing/plots.html

Let me know if you need help with sphinx or editing the documentation.

content.raw: If you like the global state (and I can see why you might) I think it might be better to have something like `yt.ion()` to more clearly indicate to the user that the interactive state is global.
content.html: If you like the global state (and I can see why you might) I think it might be better to have something like yt.ion() to more clearly indicate to the user that the interactive state is global.

content.raw: Getting it from the global interactivity value would be assuming that the global variable hadn't changed before calling for the instance of plot to be shown. If it had been changed, the plot instance would still be interactive, but all plots after the change would not be interactive.
content.html: Getting it from the global interactivity value would be assuming that the global variable hadn't changed before calling for the instance of plot to be shown. If it had been changed, the plot instance would still be interactive, but all plots after the change would not be interactive.

content.raw: I'm guessing this doesn't provide support for the buttons to pan, zoom, etc when not running from the notebook?
content.html: I'm guessing this doesn't provide support for the buttons to pan, zoom, etc when not running from the notebook?

content.raw: The buttons are there (in the OSX backend anyway) but we need to add callback events to yt so that pressing those buttons does "the right thing". Optimally it would also go the other way, so if you do `slc.zoom(5)`, the plot is automatically redrawn without doing `slc.show()`. Austin has told me offline that he wants to work on that in another pass. That should be *much* easier now that interactive backends work :)
content.html: The buttons are there (in the OSX backend anyway) but we need to add callback events to yt so that pressing those buttons does "the right thing". Optimally it would also go the other way, so if you do slc.zoom(5), the plot is automatically redrawn without doing slc.show(). Austin has told me offline that he wants to work on that in another pass. That should be much easier now that interactive backends work :)

content.raw: Ah, ok. yes, it works for me using the osx backend but not the qt backend (on OS X).
content.html: Ah, ok. yes, it works for me using the osx backend but not the qt backend (on OS X).

description: At the expense of requiring a slight amount of typing when entering environments with unique matplotlib backends, this update allows all plots in yt to display in every interactive environment matplotlib supports.
